customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Come on, let me take you on a journey through the wonderful world of cards — I'm quite the skilled player myself!"
<color=#ece5d8>Hint: Mualani's deck revolves around "Summons" and excels at frequently switching active characters to flexibly deal damage.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.desc:
"Splish-Splash Wavechaser" Mualani

Swellrider of Perennial Springs

customize.name: Xiangling
customize.desc:
"Exquisite Delicacy" Xiangling

As a chef, she is practically omnipotent.

customize.name: Kaedehara Kazuha
customize.desc:
Scarlet Leaves Pursue Wild Waves: Kaedehara Kazuha

Flowers and birds are a dear pleasure to one winding under the moonlight.

customize.name: Match Invitation Letter
customize.desc: You can select a player from the Player List via the invitation board, and then entrust The Cat's Tail to send out an invitation using this Invitation Letter. The invited player will head over to the tavern and wait for a duel with you.

"It doesn't matter if I lose a round, I believe in my deck — we'll win in the end!"
<color=#ece5d8>Special Rule: "Mualani" starts with the Talent Card "Night Realm's Gift: Crests and Troughs" equipped.</color>

customize.name: Player EXP
customize.desc: Obtained by winning Genius Invokation TCG matches. Every duel you won builds upon the paths to victory, such is the act of earning experience itself. To know how to overcome and subdue the adversary in any situation is the greatest strength that a player can possess.

value.name: Mualani
value.desc: A well-known guide in Natlan who owns a watersports shop, and expert in all forms of wave-chasing.

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Attach <color=#ffffff>Bitey Shark</color> to self, then enter <color=#ffffff>Nightsoul's Blessing</color> and gain 2 <color=#ffffff>"Nightsoul points."</color> (This skill cannot be used after the character enters <color=#ffffff>Nightsoul's Blessing</color> )
(Characters with <color=#ffffff>Bitey Shark</color> attached can use the Technique: <color=#ffffff>Sharky Surfboard</color> )
<color=#ece5d8>Nightsoul's Blessing</color>
<color=#ffd780>Status</color>
The character to which this is attached accumulates <color=#ffffff>"Nightsoul points."</color> (Max 2 points)

<color=#ffd780>Equipment Card</color>
<color=#ffffff>After either side switches characters, and Mualani is the active character:</color> Spend 1 <color=#ffffff>Nightsoul point</color> to apply <color=#ffffff>Bite Target</color> to the opposing active character.
<color=#ffffff>Technique</color> : Sharky Surfboard
When the character to which this is attached has 0 <color=#ffffff>Nightsoul points</color> , discard this card. When this card is discarded, the attached character's <color=#ffffff>Nightsoul's Blessing</color> ends.

<color=#ffd780>Technique</color>
Switch to your previous character, attach 1 <color=#ffffff>Bite Target</color> stack to the opposing active character. (If your standby characters have all been defeated, consume 1 extra <color=#ffffff>Nightsoul point</color> )

<color=#ffd780>Summon</color>
<color=#ffffff>End Phase:</color> Deal 2 <color=#80c0ff>Hydro DMG</color> .
<color=#ffffff>Usa</color> <color=#ffffff>ge(s): 2</color> (Can stack, no stack limit)

Applies Hydro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Vaporize</color> : DMG +2 for this instance
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Electro-Charged</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, deal 1 Piercing DMG to all opposing characters except the target
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#99ffff>Cryo</color> <color=#ffffff>] Frozen</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, the target is unable to perform any Actions this Round (Can be removed in advance after the target receives +2 Physical or Pyro DMG)
<color=#ffffff>[</color> <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> <color=#ffffff>+</color> <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> <color=#ffffff>] Bloom</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Dendro Core</color> ] that grants +2 DMG to the next instance of Pyro or Electro DMG

<color=#ece5d8>Technique</color>
When the active character is equipped with a Technique card, they can use the corresponding Technique.
Using a Technique counts as a Combat Action. If the character is unable to use Skills due to conditions like Frozen, Petrification, or Stun, they are also unable to use the Technique.
Using a Technique is not considered as using a Skill. Therefore, it cannot trigger effects such as "After using a skill" or "After the character triggers an Elemental Reaction." Damage dealt by using a Technique is not considered Damage dealt by the character.
<color=#ece5d8>Usage(s)</color>
After this card's effect is triggered, 1 <color=#ffffff>Usage</color> of it will be consumed.
This card will be discarded immediately once it has 0 <color=#ffffff>Usages</color> remaining.
<color=#ece5d8>Bite Target</color>
<color=#ffffff>When receiving damage dealt by Mualani or Shark Missile:</color> Remove this effect. For each stack, increase the damage by 2.
(Stacks are accumulative, with no limit.)
